column4: This street is good if you're looking for options of restaurants and some stores! We went to a great restaurant on this street called the Bank and Baron. It's a very old bank that has now turned into a pub. It holds a lot of history in there and they've decorated it really nicely. If you go, make sure you...

I walk on Stephens avenue a lot and in the winter it can be very slippery. In the summer you need to be careful and watch for the cyclists as there is two way cycle traffic down the center of the walking street. Put the phone down and only take pictures when you are stationary otherwise you might wander into...
Lots of places to stop by and shop/eat and people watch. More fun in the summer with attractions like bands and street performers.

We visited the street several times during our time in Calgary. The restaurants, art, and buildings are interesting and it is a vibrant part of this city. Definitely great for people watching and for evening activities. There are quaint coffee shops, family owned restaurants, one of a kind chef owned restaurants, and a few chains as well.
Great places to shop and eat and to people watch. You are right downtown without the fear or noise of traffic. Most interesting.
I love being downtown but I would love to see more shops and markets here. It gets very quiet on the weekend!

Stephens Ave is a great place to find a lunch venue outside or to knock off a little early with some friends and meet for cocktails. A very diverse mix with f establishments ranging from shopping to restaurants and office buildings.
great shops, i have visited in both July and December.In the summer it's lively with food trucks and buskersmany restarauts

Stephen Avenue (8th Avenue SW between 3rd St SW and 1st St SE) is a mostly pedestrian street with plenty of restaurants, coffee shops, pubs, and shopping. It is alive in an otherwise fairly dead downtown core area.Perhaps you can ignore the fact that the city is designed for cars instead of people and do a walking tour of...
Feel downtown, Feel Live, Food, Drinks, Shopping you will find everything walking down the Stephen Avenue.
if you like shopping this is the place for you and with some good restaurant's you will have a good day but you must be into shopping
Stephen ave is nice to walk down, has some nice restaurants. Has a decent atmosphere in summer when everyone can sit on the balconies.

The trafficless Stephen Street mall is mainly paved and has established deciduous trees which are beautiful in the autumn and has a number of interesting historic buildings along with some interesting new designs.Lots of cafes and places to eat,buy souvenirs,clothes shopping or just enjoy the outdoors.Buskers and beggars go hand in hand.

Our first visit to Calgary was in October 2016 and our hotel concierge suggested we walk on Stephen Avenue, a pedestrian walkway void of cars and traffic with a large variety of different shops, bistros, restaurants, pubs and retail stores. At each end of Stephen Avenue are large pieces of artwork that confirm we were entering a different part of...
Enjoy the walk through Stephen avenue with lots of local pubs and entertainment spots to spend days enjoying the local Alberta way of life

We were here on a sunny Saturday afternoon, there are lots of restaurants, pubs and some other shops. From what we could make out it is a mall during the day/evening - so pedestrian only, which was great. Lots of people and some interesting sculpture and buildings. Down the Eastern end the Olympic Plaza and civic buildings are worth a...
I always make a point of walking Stephen Ave Mall. Lots of pubs,restaurants, and shops. Always nice at Christmas!

A trip to Calgary isn't complete without a walk down Stephen Ave. Be aware though that there are a lot of questionable people here during the early mornings. But a night and in the evenings there is a really fun vibe. People are dressed nice as there is a lot of great restaurants and pubs along the Ave. There is...
Typical city promenade with restaurants (high-end and not), pubs and souvenir shops. Gets lively at night. Seemed like a relatively safe place to hang out. Great place to people watch.

Now a bit passed its best but it provides a welcome relief from the 15 walkway. The shops are a mundane (except Hudsons Bay) but it's a short cut into many of the more modern buildings and down to city hall.
It was fun to just walk around and explore. There is so much always going on. Lots of restaurants, shops and more!!
this used to be one of my favorite strolls, now you cant walk feet without getting requests for your hard earned cash.
Many people take in the sun, sights and sounds during the week days on Stephen Avenue. There are lots of vendors and buskers. It's totally awesome!

It would hard to imaging visiting Calgary without visiting the Stephen Avenue Walk. Firstly, it's free to walk the length of it from Olympic Plaza to Mewata Armoury. The Walk can't be beat for people watching, especially mid-day any day. And there are countless restaurants and food stops for all budgets, in case you're hungry. For culture vultures, aside from...
A pretty pedestrian street with some of the older buildings in what is a modern City. Plenty of shops,bars and restaurants and a good museum.

We learned of the street only when in Calgary, so we walked blocks on it. I don't know when it was built, but sometimes, as when we went, it was a pedestrians only experience. Many vendors were out selling their wares and we learned it was a once-a-week, or once-a-month experience. We pobably spent hours there, and it was fun....
We enjoyed walking down Stephen Ave pedestrian mall and especially liked the sculptures along the way!
Stephen Avenue was a short walk from out hotel, and there were shops, farmers markets, craft vendors,etc. Stephen Avenue has many restaurants.

I work a couple of blocks from Stephen Avenue so I often take this route, instead of going inside. In the summer, this is a great spot to grab a quick bit or sit on a patio, to people watch. There are great restaurants and shops, that you don't want to miss!
good to be in a non traffic area. lots of cafes and shopping. was some street theatre that we enjoyed. changes in early morning for the worse.

The street is approx. 2 blocks long with lots of restaurants, bars, and shopping. Lots of old buildings with some different types of architecture. I thinks this place is good to visit in daytime ,lots of gentrifying going on nearby. It's a financial area during the day so it becomes when quiet after 17h.

We were traveling with a dog, so this was something that we could do with her in tow. We rode the CTRAIN into downtown and walked Stephen Ave. Yes, we were limited since we had our dog, but one of us stayed outside with her when the other went into stores. Too cold to eat outside, so we didn't take...
This street is largely pedestrianized with a great collection of shops, restaurants and cafes. It is a really pleasant experience just to walk along the street.
I would recommend this. My husband and I enjoyed leisurely walking and enjoying the shops and restaurants.

A great little stretch of pedestrian & bike only road with gift shops, bars, restaurants and boutiques along the way. A lot of little pubs, chain restaurants and stand alone gives no end of options for a bite to eat and a drink. Close enough for a quick walk to the river and to Scotia Centre as well, we did...

Very close to the Glenbow Museum and Calgary Tower, this might be a good place to visit in the daytime for eating or shopping or in the evenings to party but there is always quite a few strange people hanging around begging for money, drunk, acting weird or all three together. I didn't really enjoy the area.

its the center of the downtown with a lot of happenings, a lot of pubs, shopping centers, a lot of restaurants, sometimes stores at the road. It's fascinating to walk along the street, but at someplace, it can be a bit frightening with drunker.

We happened to be staying at the Hyatt Regency in downtown Calgary and came upon Stephen Avenue as a lark, we walked out of our hotel and this is right there. A crazy, fabulous street with pubs, bars, restaurants, shops everything you can imagine all in one location. You can spend an entire day here walking up and down. Street...
First time to downtown Calgary and we took a stroll down Stephen Avenue. There were performers in the street, and an interesting crowd as well as some unique stores.
Lots of bars and restaurants of good quality, Stephen Avenue is most notable for the public sculptutes that are on the route, or just parallel to it on 6th & 7th.

We parked at the Telus Centre at the east end of Stephen Avenue at 1st Street Se and mosied our way down to Murietta's on 1st Street Sw.The street just seemed to be awakening at noon as restaurants with patios were getting set for customers who wished to enjoy the remaining dregs of summertime.
We really enjoyed walking along this pedestrian area of Calgary. There are lots of cafes, bars and restaurants and there is a great atmosphere here. The gift shops tended to be cheaper here, too!

If you want a nice market type vibe with street entertainment and lots of individual shops with character, then this is the place for you. It is pedestrianised and has loads of quirky little gift shops and also plenty of restaurants etc. It also connects you to the larger malls with chain stores.

Popular area for restaurants, bars, pubs and shops. Street market feel but definitely the place to lunch if you work nearby. Great there is no cars to worry about and close to the Tower. Also souvenir shops here too. Nothing overly special about it really. But you will know doubt visit here as the centre area is an easy walk...

Always wonderful people watching, great stores and places to eat all along it. During the day you can amble along taking in the sites. In the summer there is a market every second Tuesday - great fun! Live music all summer long and if you want that Stampede feeling - for free... walk down Stephen Ave during the Stampede! Yahoo!
Loved walking this Avenue. So many different sites to see. The life this street has just speaks wonders. Looking forward to return to walk it again.

This avenue is the location for numerous events during the year and is the home of many enjoyable bars, street entertainment, restaurants and cafés. I was last there with friends just earlier this week, but it would not be unusual for me to go ten times or more in a year. You will find good food, in varying degrees of...
Really cute shops and on a nice day beautiful to just walk about. Lots of stores and restaurants, some high end shops too. The street is closed off which is nice.
All here; restaurants, bars, tourist shops and access to the malls. A great pedestrian spot which is always busy in the evening
We stopped in Calgary after our flight and had a lovely lunch here listening to live music, sadly only played for an hour.
Nice place to walk and some events happening there. I was there on the Philippine's Festival.Just enjoy watching Downtown with lots of restaurants.

A busy conference left little time for relaxation on my recent trip to Calgary. Stephen Avenue Walk, however, provided a decent venue for a bit of de-stressing early morning, mid-day, or evening. As a single female traveler, I felt safe. As a shopper, I felt amused. As a lover-of-food, I felt satisfied with the options (ranged from food-court to cuisine)....

great ambiance along this street...plenty of eateries with terraces, bars, stores, a giant mall, shops, lots of tourists mixing with localsgreat animation, live music, you can spend the whole evening (or day) without getting bored.

This is a very nice area of calagary. There are many restaurants along this walk to choose from when looking for a bite to eat. There are also many store to shop in as well. Very close to the Fairmont hotel.
great place to get out and walk around when the weather is nice. Tons of shopping and dining. Pretty much felt like the heart of downtown.

This is essentially a shopping street, but it is a people street too. All along the several blocks going through downtown, there are interesting stores and the standard fare of any shopping centre in Canada. But here, there are plenty of places to sit, music to listen to, small change hopefuls and buskers.There are food trucks and public art. I...
A very welcoming Avenue walk, Lots of places to sit and enjoy the views. Lots of market style shops along the way. Leads up to the main shopping center in city center.

The main appeal here is the beautiful stretch of preserved historic buildings in a pedestrian-friendly downtown environment. We went on a Tuesday afternoon and caught some nice vendors in the streets serving delicious ethnic food, vinyl records, trendy clothes and more. Most actual shops are higher-end but it's a cheap attraction if you're just staying on the walk outside.Make...

There was a big screen TV set up on Stephen Ave and lots of lawn chairs to lounge in and watch the Olympics. It is a good street to stroll along without the worry of traffic. Very friendly people all along the way.
Stayed in Calgary when we was on holiday and its well worth a visit to Stephen Avenue, great place for shopping, bars and restaurants.
The flags the flowers the people, loads going on good restaurants good shops. We found a good shopping mall in downtown Calgary but Stephens Avenue walk is a must to experience the atmosphere

Stephen Avenue can be a wonderful summer stroll with entertainers, special events and great restaurants that makes for a memorable weekend experience. Its part of downtown Calgary life, so you tend to overlook its charm. A recent Sunday experience corrected that. Amazing flowers, the Olympics on the big screen, people having drinks and snacks on the patios - all contributed...
amazing walking area , wonderful for summer downtown walk with lot of bars and malls , perfect for families and singles and even couples

If you're here during the Calgary Stampede, this is one of the places where you can get your fill of FREE pancakes. But, typically you'll find it filled with vendors and buskers there for your entertainment and shopping pleasure. A reminder of Florida Avenue in Buenos Aires and Las Ramblas in Barcelona.
Not the most popping area in Calgary to go out but it offers a nice variation of places to spend your downtown visit.
Lived in Calgary many years ago when you could actually drive, walk on 8th Ave.It was good at that time but it is great now. Just to walk up and down the street and enjoy
Great walk thru downtown, lots of shops and restaurants, banks etc and great "smokies" along the walk way. Much more interesting than the other avenues in dt calgary - especially on a nice sunny day

A lot goes on at the mall at lunch time. If weather permits the outside cafes are great to people watch. There is entertainment on every block,bands,mimes,musicians,and much more. If nothing else you can watch all the tattoos everyone seems to be sporting these days trot bye.
Lots of restaurants, street was narrow so not much traffic. Shopping, food, drinks. All here in a great atmosphere.

We visited during the week about lunch time when people would be strolling along. Calgary caught us by surprise, as we did not expect there to be anything charming about the city. We loved the old world feel of the inter-city mixed with modern architecture backdrop. Lots of flowers, cafes, small pubs, and a vibrant feel. The surrounding bike paths,...

A variety of stores to fit any budget....from expensive fashion to the dollar store. Stroll down the street or explore the 3 level enclosed mall. Only negative was the rooftop gardens were closed with some construction and not accessible.

It was very busy on Friday and Saturday. Loved the pubs and restaurants with outside terraces. Lots of shopping adjacent to it. The live entertainment, food trucks and market booths made it really nice for those of us who are not from places that have this.Even got to watch a Hari Krishna parade. Very colorful and unique-like a mini...
A well maintained pedestrian mall with storefront access to both malls and individual businesses. Limited vehicle traffic permitted after 6pm.
Visited on Sunday afternoon 4:00ish it was quite quiet, bars open but not much else. Went back later to eat more people about but not the buzz we were expecting.

It's a nice walk during lunch as the patios are full and street vendors abound. There's always some live entertainment which is nice. Food trucks are decent and they actually have some vendors offering treasures you want. Overall it's not a dull walk but I can see it getting boring fast if you go too often

Love walking from one end to the other. Start at the Olympic Plaza / City Hall (east end). Or down by the Bankers Hall (west end). Day time or night great walk surrounded by, great restaurants / bars and shopping.

Stephen Ave. Walk is a pedestrian only mall with a few hotels, tourist shops, and numerous restaurants and bars. There are some nice older sandstone buildings along parts of the street although some of the newer buildings are very out of place.The Walk seems as though it would be great way to spend week-end afternoons and appears to be...

As downtown pedestrian malls go, Stephen Avenue is pretty run of the mill. Rope square at the far east end is great for events or eating lunch by the fountain, but the stretch from Macleod Trail to Centre street is pretty devoid of storefronts and other diversions. From Centre St. to 1st St. SW there are some shops and good...

This is where to eat, drink, play, shop and people watch all in one place. It's also surrounded by meeting spots, parkettes, connection to the skyway as well as the place to take in all of Calgary's culture/history and some amazing exhibits at the museum. The street is shut down from traffic during the day and is lively with pub's...
I loved walking around this area. Nice weather and no stress walking around. Plenty to eat and drink.

On our last day in Calgary we decided to take a walk downtown and Stephen Ave was recommended. First the traffic downtown is miserable; between the construction on every turn and the closed off streets it was quite hard to navigate. We finally got there and were somewhat disappointed--mostly tourist shops or standard fare, high-end clothiers. There was the big...

This vibrant street in downtown Calgary is lined with shops and restaurants. It is a pedestrian-only street during daytime so anyone can walk freely and leisurely. Great views from the elevated walkways that connect the buildings on opposite sides of the street.

A walk down Stephens Avenue was very beautiful. However if you are traveling with children under 21 there is only one restaurant that will allow kids under 21, Milestones which was great and kid friendly

I loved walking down Stephen Ave. Not only are their several fantastic restaurants, bars, and pubs, but the shopping is also easily accessible with lots of variety. I loved how clean it was and I will definitely go back again.
When the sun is out, it is a great place to walk. Many shops to take a look at, and places to eat and drink. Core Shopping Mall is here too

Summer is best, for this walk. There is always something going on here. Let your heart lead you... some lovely artisan moments with music and craft. Also political walks. Food options and people watching. If you are used to the public squares of Europe for people watching, this is as close as you get in Calgary.

Calgary is a city with many types of people. You will see all of them on Stephen Avenue! Don't be scared of the beardo busker, or the slightly shady bottle pickers - everyone enjoys the atmosphere here and no one wants spoil it by making you uncomfortable. Embrace the craziness of this area and you will find it invigorating to...
This was only a short walk from our hotel and gave us the opportunity for shopping and for dining. The adjacent street has the free tram system so great for tired legs.

I really enjoy visiting different cities and always like dedicated pedestrian areas. I found this one to be so-so as it was very commercial. We happened to be there just prior to Stampede and there were many vendors selling cowboy hats and the like. It was fun to see all the business people and tourists in their western wear. The...
The atmosphere along this street both during the day and evening during the 'Stampede' is amazing no matter which bar/restaurant we decided to visit. The street acts on show were brilliant. Loved it.

Stephen Avenue Walk occupies three or four blocks of 8th Avenue in downtown Calgary. I was there during Stampede week, so most places (and workers and pedestrians) were decked out in a western theme. It reminded me of Broadway in Nashville. There are lots of restaurants with outdoor seating, street entertainment and shops. It is apparently closed to traffic at...
Was a nice walk but there were very few trees like in other pictures,sign said they were replacing them. It was a Sat also and lots of the shops weren't open either
Great area to walk around. Lots to see and hear...music, bands, people everywhere! Great place to eat.
A pedestrian walk with lots of restaurants and no car trafficin parts until 6pm. It definitely caters to tourists being near the Calgary Tower. Many stores & souvenir shops here
Every big vibrant city has one of these promenades, and this one is in the center of Calgary. Shops, bars, restaurants, street performers and musicians, and quick access to the Calgary Tower.

The best street in Calgary. Most of the 'old' buildings in Calgary (it's a young city) are located on this street and it makes for an enjoyable walk. It's full of fun places to eat and drink - we stopped at the James Joyce for a drink outside. Plus it has the best shop in Calgary - Lammles for your...
A good place to relax and walk and spend time with your loved one. Grab a bite to eat or something to drink and just enjoy the walk.
We love to stroll down this Avenue and leisurely walk with a coffee and view all the different sights and sounds .Recommendfor anyone visiting or living in Calgary.
Stephen Avenue is lined with shops and street vendors and is a nice stroll. During the Stampede you will find many tables out selling cowboy hats and other western themed items.
There are so many restaurants and night spots to choose from. It's great to walk along the street, sit for a drink outside and people-watch.
Take this walk and have a historic folder in hand to find all the historic properties. There is much shopping and eating and drinking in the area.
8th Avenue SW has lots of restaurants and bars and lots of interesting shops. We found lots of places to eat and drink and a great cowboy boot shop.
Great place to shop, dine and listen to live concert performances- something for everyone- wide variety of dining choices!

We enjoyed our trip to Calgary and spent a day exploring around the Stephen Avenue Walk. There's so much to see. We had lunch in a downtown cafe, walked through all sorts of shops, went to a museum which took several hours, went to an indoor garden on the 4th floor of a building and enjoyed a concert.

This was a fun stroll thru an older section of downtown buildings. We took about 1 1/2 hours total for just the walk. We ate lunch at Barons &Banks, a really cool bank converted bldg. Very similar to the one in Victoria,BC. Great ambiance and the food was excellent. Stephan Ave walk is also close to the Calgary tower and...
Bearing such names as Holt Renfrew, Stephens avenue has a wide range of shopping, mainly mid to high range. There is a Winners as well where some bargains can be found for the lucky shopper.

Start your stroll at city hall and work your way through Olympic Plaza and on down over the cobblestones of the pedestrian only walkway. This street is lines with shopping malls and restaurants and bars. It's a great place to mosey around for the day. If it's raining use the Plus 15 system of skywalks to stay indoors.
I parked at the Telus Convention Center, there are many restaurants, stores & street Buskers that were playing music, the energy of business people on the move, I love it... Its Calgary its home!!
Lots of shops and restaurants. There was a man picking up cigarette butts and garbage people had left behind at a bench I sat at.

Lots of shops and places to eat with alfresco dining you really will be spoilt for choice. A beautiful park at city hall end with lots going on in the summer.Lovely atmosphere real hub of the city. Easy to find and access.
Walkway pedestrianized at certain times of the day. See the cowboy shops, souvenir shops, Dollarama and bars. We went when it was Canada day so the whole place was alive, bustling and very busy.

Have walked it numerous time before and during Stampede Week. It is a must do when in Calgary. Walking down the middle of the street with vendors on one side and all the shops with tables of one thing or another. Great shopping, eating, drinking, and people watching. If you just walk the street, it will take less than 45...
This is just a few blocks long but the architecture is beautiful. My neck got sore from looking up at the old banks and hotels from the 1900s. Good shopping and people watching and car free.

Stephen Avenue is a great pedestrian mall (most of the time - some vehicles have limited access). Farmers market every second Tuesday. Lots of patio seating for all the restaurants, many benches for relaxing and people watching.

Nice flower baskets adorn some of the pole hangars along this street. There are nice shops all the way along like Winners and Cowboy cloths etc. Lots of food places, my favourite Falafel King. There would be good steaks to be had as well and nice Vietnamese places too. Even a cooking school with food for sale.There were musicians...
Located in Downtown Calgary, in between of the buildings and the mall. This place gets full during Stampede parade and employees' lunch break.

This is a wonderful pedestrian shopping and dining area in downtown Calgary. Lots of interesting shops and watering holes, street vendors and entertainments. Check out the free City Parks Devonian Gardens in the Core Mall. One of a kind beautiful indoor space to walk around or just sit and relax.

Lots of people walking around especially when the weather is nice. A walk with shops, restaurants, live music, local vendors etc. It is a good place to spend an afternoon and enjoy. No cars allowed from 600am to 600pm.

I was riding my bike the other day and thought I would cruise down Stephen Avenue..well that was not the brightest idea..it was wall to wall people ..outdoor market, music and food trucks..not at all easy to even walk with a bike through the throng however sure fun for those with time to amble through the area
our first night in town we stayed right next to Stephen Ave. How nice it was for us to just walk outside out hotel and walk this street and have a huge selection of places to eat or enjoy a cocktail.

We walked the mall and then out on the street. We caught the tail end of a dance troupe. They were really good. Took some pictures with the Famous Five and walked to the capitol building. Lots of shops along the way, vendors selling all sorts of wares, people walking to and fro, etc. Pleasant activity when the weather is...
This is the place when in Calgary downtown to spend a very leisurely afternoon and then evening of great food, entertainment and some theatre.
The architecture is gorgeous, there are always interesting personalities and it houses some great eats. I love coming downtown and walking along Stephen Avenue, just to take in the atmosphere.

Nice pleasant pedestrianised area with plenty of shops and bars along its length the main shopping street in Calgary. About 10 minutes from our hotel and easily accessible to all. Good range of shops with some unique selling points

Most recently we visited Stephen Avenue Walk on a date to Saltlik. We purposely parked a few blocks away to enjoy the atmosphere and see what's new on Stephen Ave! Definitely up there as a great walk in Calgary, especially if you love the Beltline!

Stephen Avenue Mall is centrally located and was a nice walk from out hotel the Westin.Most of it closed to vehicle traffic and was a pleasant walk throughout the mall with lots of shop and dining. Another place to visit while at the mall is the beautiful tranquil indoors Devonian Gardens.
We walked there from the International Hotel and really enjoyed all the restaurant and bar choices. Lots to choose from and lots of fun.

We were staying in Le Germain Hotel right there, so why not walk down around. Glad we did, but I would not recommend going out of your way to get here. Looks like parking might be an issue, but wasn't since we were staying in hotel.
This was quite interesting and another great walk. Lots of shops places to eat and easy for the older age group to walk.Took lots of pics, worth doing if you visit Calgary.Kristine de la Hunty
Just okay. It's nice but really not that grand. Calgary itself is just okay. Nothing spectators and this was the same. Not coming back.
Very enjoyable walk on a nice day. Some nice shops, eateries and great people. I highly recommend. I was downtown for 3 days and walked each day finding new spots for lunch and cocktails.
Walked through this area a couple of times on a recent visit to Calgary. Not to be missed, lots of restaurants, patios and shops, highly recommended.

Stephen Avenue is a pedestrian area in the heart of Calgary. Many choices for restaurants and outdoor cafes, as well as shopping. It is a very busy area on weekend evenings, but a fun place to walk and enjoy

Stephen Avenue Walk is the main street for pedestrians through the city centre. At one end was Olympic Park.On either side of the avenue are a number of restaurants, cafes and some shops. I was a little disappointed with the number of shops. Most of then were restaurants.Worth a stroll but i wouldn't make a special effort to...
enjoyed a nice stroll through the city. was a beautiful day so that helped for sure. busy but relaxing

We enjoyed walking along Stephen Avenue Walk to get a feel of the city. Stephen Avenue is a major pedestrian mall in downtown & has many interesting historical building, shops , cafes & a small street market. The street was named after George Stephen, the first president of the Canadian Pacific Railway.The mall was empty the day we visited...

Visited Stephen Avenue whilst in Calgary as only a short stroll from our hotel. Pleasant enough walk with some historical interest, interesting architecture and a number of eating and shopping options. Nice way to spend a hour or two to take in a little of the cities atmosphere and character.
Slightly more upscale than surrounding areas, filled with shops and cafes. The photographer in me loved The Trees at the west end.

Nice to walk Stephen Avenue at mid-day before heading to the Red Arrow downtown bus depot. If you are on a schedule to meet your bus, give yourself at least a couple hours to really enjoy it. Beautiful historical architecture along the avenue and the Olympic Park at the end of it (or beginning). Lots of choices for lunch and...

This is the main pedestrian walkway with cafes bars and a few shops. It's nice to stroll along and it's certainly pleasant, except for the fact that there are so many drunks and drug addicts lying about. Looking in rubbish bins or asking you for money. As a Londoner unfortunately I am used to seeing homeless people but I was...

Arrived in Calgary for a conference staying at the Hyatt Regency right next door to Stephen Ave. I walked the street on a beautiful sunny warm day window shopping and checking out the numerous restaurants and bars along the way. It's great to walk on the street and not worry about getting run down by drivers in a rush. Lots...

If you are looking for a nice walk right through the heart of Calgary, this is the place for you. With lots of shops, boutqiues, restaurants and night life - Stephen Avenue is that mix of old and new that can satisfy that tastes of any visitor or hometown person!
An interesting pedestrian-only street right through the middle of downtown. It's a great place to soak up the feel of the city but only a few of the shops caught our attention.

Stephen Avenue is a great place to walk with the family or to just stroll for the immense shopping, amazing food and multiple artwork exhibits. What makes this exploration pleasant, is that no cars are allowed along Stephen Avenue. Bicycles, strollers, skateboards, roller blades and scooters can travel safely. Due to the high buildings, the roadway is blocked from the...

Walking the Avenue is one of the pleasures I have living in Calgary.The street is much busier in the Spring and Summer months but there is always something to see and do when you walk the Avenue.If the weather is cold or rainy you can go inside and walk the mall and do some shopping.

I must have chosen the wrong day, date and time to stroll down this street, but it was boring and quiet. The shops look dull and dreary and the eateries were not as welcoming as you'd expect.I've travelled a lot, so I expected the street to be buzzing with excitement and shops and cafes to be inviting. I didn't...

Visited this wellknown avenue on two consecutive days , seems to be the busiest place during lunchtime. The Core shopping mall with the Devonian garden is worth a visit too.Had lunch of a chicken shawarma on the patio beside the pool with water fountains . Animated place with plenty of seating facilities next to the green well kept lawns.

We love Stephen Ave. The food and drink venues are really good. The staff are very friendly. Some great Western shops and the tourist shops are very reasonable. Definitely worth a walk. It is just alive with people and there always seems to be something happening to see.
This is a great street to stroll down on a sunny day. Be sure make some time to stop and check out the shops.
A real combination of old and new Calgary if you take your time and look around carefully. Take your time.
The Stephen Avenue Walk is a great place to peruse the streets and enjoy not only great meals, but some fun shopping. I have visited several times and always enjoy my time walking the street here.

We grabbed a quick overnight in Calgary. Just the two of us. With a hotel room within walking distance of Stephen Avenue our visit to #yyc was great. This attraction is perfect for relaxed wandering. Varied menu options, shopping etc. A must visit!

The street has limited access to cars, which provide a large space to walk along and explore. The street is lined with plenty of places to eat and have a pint. The streets provide plenty of neat details to see, such as artwork on the streets, sculptures and plenty of trees. Worth the stroll in my opinion.

A long time Calgary icon, Stephen Avenue is a neat little side adventure. Little shops and restaurants along the way. Buskers playing. Just a little piece of our history that we'd like to share with our visitors.

If you want to take in street musicians, people watch or just go for a walk where there is an energy this is the street to go to. Lots of places to eat both indoor and on outdoor patios. Always append time on Stephen Ave. when in Calgary. A few nice little shops as well.well
This is downtown Calgary at its best much to see and do I would suggest the warmer months to visit. A nice walk
This is where you want to go in downtown Calgary in the summer. Lots of nice restaurants, the Glenbow museum, often some kind of event. Walking only mall through the center of downtown.
It's a road with businesses and a mall. It's alright in the summer but it's really just a road with shops. Nothing special.
Awesome experience to walk down the avenue on a hot summer day. Stopping for a coffee/dessert or popping into a store. I felt like a local and tourist at the same time.

Historic Stephen Ave.....such character in the heart of dt Calgary! SO MANY amazing places to eat!!!!!! Divino. Blue Vinny. Blink. Catch. Murrietta's. Wineohs. The Trib. Saltlik.I spend every weekend walking shopping and eating Stephen Ave!! It's a must visit.

Stephen Avenue is always "hopping" during Calgary Stampede. There is, of course, the normal shopping and cafes and restaurants with patio seating for friends to enjoy the Calgary summer sun. But during Stampede, the street fills up with Stampede events from free square dancing lessons, to First Nation people lining up for their parade through Rope Square (Olympic Plaza), to...

Any season there is always somewhere to go or something to see on Stephen Avenue. A wide array of restaurants and shops. In the warmer weather the music, buskers and various entertainment is a great break from the office. And in winter the snowy winter lights bring a festive feel to the avenue in the evenings. Amazing place to people...

Very accessible by public transit, Calgary's premiere outdoor shopping area is only half a dozen stops north of the Chinook Mall (by LRT, the C-Train) and a much more enjoyable experience. One block north of the train platform, you'll find dozens of shops, indoor and outdoor shopping, cafés, restaurants and experiences that differ vastly from the cliché trends of the...
I was drawn to this street because my husband's name is "Stephen" and it was quite a serendipity experience. Lots of fun little local shops, and restaurants to explore.
This street is a must see when you come to Calgary. It's an old part of downtown and it's filled with shopping, eating and just a great place to hang out

Great little hub in Calgary for more expensive eats. Lots of fine dining restaurants for steaks and dinner but always good for lunch. Great to walk down to see all the people and great for shopping too.

This is a street to have fun at night mostly, they are pubs and restaurant that the locals go after business hours, and in the same street you can go to the core mall, on the street they are not too many shops, Its a street to go walking you have to park blocks away.Its a must if you visit...

This 2, max 3 blocks walk is very nice. There's a lot of small little restaurants, pubs and bars and some clothing stores. And it takes you directly to The Core Shopping mall. They close it for cars on schedule.

Stephen Ave is a must if you are in Calgary visiting friends. There are lots of great pubs and places to eat. One of the newest is the Cactus Club. It had a great atmosphere and fantastic staff. Be prepared to wait for a table as it's new and very good..
This is gem of Calgary especially on Friday Nights. nice pubs, bars and levish restaurants. Must see place in Calgary Downtown and easily accessible from Public Transit.
On warm days this is a great spot to walk up and down to show off. Grab a spot at one of the many bar patios, but come early, the best spots fill up well before lunchtime.

I love this part of Calgary. Ok, so I love Calgary! I didn't know what to expect coming here but this was not it. Even though it was cold, there city was still alive and beautiful. There area statues everywhere and the city is very clean. This area is especially wonderful and filled with people. There are tons of places...
8th Avenue is a lovely walk when the street is closed for cars, lots of great one of a kind shops and restaurants.

I marvelled at the historical buildings they have. I saw Sportcheck, Hudsons Bay, Winners, Dollarama, Palace Theatre and different restaurants. It was fun walking around and I took a moment to appreciate the beauty of the vintage buildings around me.

Stephen Avenue is a pleasant low-key stroll through a concentrated shopping / restaurant district of Calgary. The restaurants and pubs were enticing with gourmet aromas wafting in the air, and there's an amazing array of unique shops to peruse. We also saw a few street musicians and a man with an enormous 200+lb malamute asking if we wanted a photo...

Usual bars, restaurants and shopping in downtown Calgary. Nothing special here but if downtown, some choices to relax. A couple of statutes, some art pieces that light up but overall average. Does look better during Christmas season as decorated well.

not much to say here, it's a reclaimed street that is pedestrian friendly to appeal to shoppersif you like to shop i guess it would work for yousometimes there are other attractions but you would still be downtown

I really enjoyed strolling along Stephen Avenue; I highly recommend visiting if you are in Calgary. There is a nice mix of restaurants and shopping, and it is a nice way to spend some time in a fun and interesting section of this wonderful city.

The atmosphere is very good. It's so different than other place in down town. Walking on this street feels like isolated from the noisy city. The small restaurants are beautiful too. Should check out when you have some free time.

I love Stephen Avenue! This street has a little bit of everything for everyone. Where your looking for a great place to eat, go for a stroll, or do some shopping you will have a great time. This street is closed to cars so you do have park and walk. In the summer they usually have many different venues or...
Even it's never full, it's a nice place in downtown to go shopping or a drink at night. As a biker it seems hard to bike there, even it says it's a shared road.
Lots of little shops. The street is closed off for pedestrians only - Great shopping. Looking forward to coming back!

Sidewalk patios, shops and plenty to see make this a must see on any stop in Calgary. Definitely my favorite street to walk along when I'm downtown and the first place I start looking for something to eat

Stephen Avenue is a fun experience with some great shopping and food places. I agree that in the summer the place is buzzing and comes alive outside. But, year round it is still a nice street to poke around and grab a bite. Take the bus or C-train and avoid parking issues.
Love walking down Stephen Avenue mall in the summer. The street is buzzing with venders and business people ....
As a Calgarian I visit this street often. Nice coffee shops and pubs and often art & musicians on the pleasant pedestrian only street.
Did a bit of shopping while in town for a conference. Neat art on the street and a pleasant pedestrian only street.
They close this street to cars during the day till 6 pm. What a great idea. The shopping, the restaurants, the Happy Hours, all great. Do not miss when in Calgary.

Eighth Avenue in downtown Calgary is closed to vehicle traffic, making it an attractive and inviting shopping and dining destination, with bars and pubs, fine dining and fast food, theaters, bookstores, and many unique shops. A great place to spend a day, or a night.
The crowd after 3pm is much friendlier in this area. There are so many great shops and restaurants to check out. I'd certainly come back when visiting Calgary again.

Ma Kettle enjoys walking the 'Walk', but I'm not a fan. I dislike the bikes that zip past the unsuspecting pedestrian, and the bums with hands out for my 'spare' cash. I don't have any 'spare' cash, mine is all spoken for. Besides, we support certain charities who ensure our donations are properly allotted to providing basic needs to families...
during fall season this street has nothing attractive to show. maybe we visited too early in the morning and at evening the cafes and restaurants change the atmosohire
Much to see and do on this pedestrian only street. Shops to visit, neat food carts and restaurants - very much worth your time to take a wander down Stephen Avenue if you're in downtown Calgary!
Cool place to walk down during summer. they usually have vendors selling different things and great pubs and restaurants.

A must for any traveller to Calgary. You will see everyone from the local street people and during 9-5 M-F the working stiffs of the city. If you like watching people this is the place to do it and then you can have fine dining to street food and then there is the shopping, what more could anyone ask for9

It's nice to go for a walk here. There are some shops to buy souvernirs. You can find people from different nationalities and speaking their languages. There are also many restaurants and pubs to taste good meals and drinks.

A very attractive pedestrian mall. Visited during the day. It was lively with lots of buildings to admire. The restaurants were plentiful and most had outdoor patios. Although we were not able to revisit in the evening the Walk looked a great place to spend an evening.

On a sunny day , in summer this is an interesting street to travel on. The people, buildings and shops will entertain until you find what you want. There is fast food and Olympic Plaza on the east end of the avenue. The Devonian Gardens can be found at 4th street.

I have walked this mall twice a day for 30 years. Now that the oil boom has dried up the downtown core seems like a barren wasteland save for the annoying critters that spit, swear, harass, intimidate, beg, ride bicycles they could never afford, lineup 10 deep to clean out the butts from ashtrays. If I didn't work downtown I...
Lively precinct lined by buildings with character and interesting eateries and shops, and street music performances.
Stephen Avenue is the street to be when something goes on in downtown. It is a nice place to stroll on a sunny day, but it's not the most interesting street we've walked in in Canada neither
A bit of a Vegas feel without the Vegas! Lots of good pubs, restaurants and street performers. Easy walk from one end to the other and cheap parking in the parkade on the west end during weekends.
There are many shops, stores and a large variety of restaurants on Stephen Avenue. It's a great place to go when you are downtown and love to people watch, as it's always busy in the summer months.
some good eats and shops. nicest goodlife fitness built in an old bank.few cars to worry about parking is difficult to find tho. best go on a lazy sunday.

Enjoyable walk on a sunny day, and a good opportunity to see business Calgary on a lunch break, but shopping itself was just ok. I prefer Chinook or Market Mall for actual shopping - restaurants seemed geared towards bars/lounges, so not a lot of options for family eating (we ended up at the food fair at The Core Mall).

Well if you are from Calgary or not ....and it is a nice warm, sunny day in YYC ....this is the place to be. Great to wonder, window shop, watch people and just stroll. They have some of the top restaurants in the area. No matter what your plans are you can enjoy the sights, great food and wine and...
We enjoyed our stroll and light lunch on the Stephen Avenue Walk after our visit to the Glenbow Museum. Many, many places to eat and lot of good places to shop!
Super spot on a nice day. Near perfect on one of those surprise warm days during the spring or fall. Walk, drink, eat, drink some more.

In North American cities in general there are very few pedestrian only streets, so I was happy to find out Calgary had one. On a Tuesday afternoon, there weren't too many people around, but there was still a buzzing energy to the street. It stretches about 4-5 blocks for pedestrians only, lined with many cool shops and restaurants. There were...
Stephen Ave is just the best urban area ever! Within Downtown Calgary, it is just the right spot to go for a walk, hang out with friends, get some quality food or go shopping.

We during the stampede and the place was bursting with colors and music. All kinds of stores can be found in this short stretch that can be covered in about 20 minutes. There are multiple shopping centers on this road. Plenty of dining options too. This is the center of town.
I don't think I've been to Stephen Avenue in quite a few years before today. Beautiful area to go for a walk with many restaurants and such along both sides. I highly recommend.

Went here last Saturday, people watched, stopped for a drink and some appetizers, and just took our time walking around down town. Everyone was so friendly, and it sure nice not to have any traffic driving down the road.Great for people visiting Calgary

On a beautiful day in Calgary son (80!) we walked to Stephen Avenue to spend some time. The street is a pedestrian walkway for 3-4 long city blocks. Restaurants outside we're teaming with people eating and/or drinking. There's not too much shopping, just many places to people walk. Fun, low key

The Stephen Avenue walk is kinda a non traffic shopping street with beautifully laid out shops and eateries. It is a great experience especially for people who do not find such free space in crowded cities. Must go and do some shopping and listen to some music

We walked down here a few times and once as part of a walking tour. We were visiting during the stampeded so it will be very different. The bars and restaurants were all full and street entertainers trying to earn some money and on top of that we were being shown interesting buildings. Good stuff

Lively pedestrian street with lots of shops, restaurants and bars. Nice place to people-watch. Starts out from the 1988 Olympic skating ring - which becomes a water fountain/dipping pool for kids in the summer, and runs a few blocks. Easy walk.
All the times i've been here it has been full of homeless people begging for money. Not my favorite part of the city at all!

I would say that Stephen Ave is a fun lunch time stroll for people watching and some street distractions. I would not make a special trip, but if you are downtown at lunchtime, give it a chance.Buskers can be found but are not as high profile as some cities. Traffic free save for cyclists who probably should find a...

This area is great to walk around during the summer season. great restaurants with different vibes are all around, so it's hard to pick. The only concern I have is during stampede time is when it will get very crowded, so I recommend avoiding that time frame. most stores and restaurants have set of shop in old fashioned buildings on...

This avenue its a place you can go any time during the day or night. Its filled with restaurants and bars. On summer time it host lots of festival and music presentations. Its a must to go when in Calgary

This is just not the image of a big city pedestrian street. Even at the best of times, it does not have the vibrance of a similar street in a city of equal size.Apart from a few mediocre restaurants and unexciting shops, there's not much for one to linger.

Good walking no traffic good restaurants,bars,fashion stores,books stores always can meet different peoples foreigners musicians native peoples,good Ave for entertainment.Beautiful flower baskets,very pleasant during the day.Now we getting closer to stamped you find few real cowboys

This is a nice walk free of cars in downtown Calgary! A little shady in areas, but very pleasant during the day. On the walk, you will find restaurants, souvenir shops, shopping centres, and small boutique stores.

If this is the "main drag", what does everyone do here? All the little shops close at 6 or 7pm, so there was no shopping. Stephen Ave wasn't particularly scenic, and though I felt pretty safe walking along the [pretty run down] strip, it is barren past 14th street. The restaurants and bars that we did stop into were adorable,...

Pedestrianized area (except evenings when traffic is allowed) in Downtown Calgary, with several shops and numerous bars and eateries, many of which have outdoor seating. Quite a nice area with flower baskets and little lights strung across the streets. Not as big as expected, or as many shops but still worth a wander. There are a few indoor shopping centres...

I love going down Stephen Avenue during lunchtime. The street is bustling and there is so much going on! It's a lovely street that does not have any cars on it, but is lined with shops, vendors, and restaurants. It's a fun place to go, especially in the summer when it's hot and more people are out and about. Recommend...

If you are visiting Calgary for the first time, I suggest you visit this area. It can be easily reached from the train no matter what part of the city you are coming from. It is right in the heart of downtown Calgary but it is tucked behind the main train line.Here's what you can find during summer time:...

Not a Las Vegas strip, but you can walk from East to West (from grand museums, and theatres to shopping heaven) without any cars trying to run you over (except after 6pm some nights). There are some interesting architecture and sculptures. Worth the walk.

All the the days when I was coming home I walked by Stephan Avenue. Had many shops, restaurants and the most impressive are the people making music and art, all very excited. It is beautiful, I loved when was sunset and you can see all lights.
Te most wonderful street in Calgary! You need a photo in this place, is really Beauty and always has a lot of people. Is really near from Calgary tower.

This is a great place to visit in the summer, especially in and around the lunch hours. There's lots of activity, music, food trucks, tents selling wares, shops and restaurants. Pick up some food and wander down the avenue. It can get quieter in the evenings and on the weekends (downtown Calgary becomes "empty" when workers leave for the day),...

I love walking into Stephen Avenue everyday..there are many restaurants,shops, malls,and my all time favorite is the dollar store.I go and visit it every alternate day to buy some funky and crazy stuff for my home and kitchen..this place is very happening during summers. :)

Weekends are quiet here. If you are looking for some Western stores, Lammeles and McCormicks have the cowboy wear you might be interested in. Winners, Sportcheck and other outdoor sports wear stores along here as well as liquor store, Shoppers. Lots of great restaurants for dining and patios when it stops snowing!

Nice long walkway with great sceneries, time goes so fast when here so it's better to come in the morning, great for shopping, best shop for me was holt Renfrew, banana republic and Guess plus lots of restaurants.

While the architecture provides an historical narrative of early Calgary, this is a lonely walk with little atmosphere. Most cities have some vibrancy and pizzaz but this was a pretty souless walk looking at shops and the occasional sculptres. Sadly Calgary is not really set up for tourists.
This walkway is impressive. There are beautiful art works scattered throughout the avenue and a variety of different eateries and shops to visit. It can get windy though so wear your woolies.
This is a great area for shopping, dining and drinks. Lots of restaurants and pubs and great shopping as a side dish.

plenty of interesting stores but too busy for my liking. I go to shop and try out new foods but the crowds can get to you. It is downtown so if you are staying close to there I would recommend a stroll down stephen avenue

Pedestrian friendly strip in downtown Calgary. Tons of restaurants and shops both sides of the street. Runs parallel to The Core shopping mall. One block north of the Calgary Tower. If you're in Calgary, it's a definite spot to check out!

It's a short stroll in a rather bland setting. They're trying but it's still nothing that special. Lots of shady characters asking for money. We stopped at a pub for lunch and basically walked down one side and up the other side and felt like the afternoon was wasted. It was rather disappointing. And what's up with the downtown core...

A pedestrian street right in the heart of Calgary. During Summer, that place is full of activities. During the week at lunch time, all the offices are empty and everybody have a drink or two on the fews patio on Stephen Ave. Nice new shops. Good restaurant. During winter, with the lights it feels magical. Stephen Ave IS Calgary.

It stretches for blocks with shops on both sides and lots of vendors selling miscellaneous goods from jewelry, hats, clothing, to art.If you get there early enough you can sit down on a bench & just people watch if that is your thing.There is a large mall off Stephen Avenue that goes from The Bay to Holt Renfrew...

Lots of activities and places to shop. You can watch the Parade of Wonders before Comic Con or grab fish and chips on an outdoor patio. Fairly quiet after dark, though. Lots of the shops close at 6. Check hours of your chosen establishment before going down.
Lots of restaurants, cafés, and some stores. Many had outside seating. Closed to traffic. Many hanging baskets, so it was very colorful.

We found this street on the last day in Calgary and didn't get to spend much time there, but this is the place to go for souveniers, dining and entertainment all in one place. They block 4-5 blocks off to traffic and you can just walk down the middle of the street where vendors have their wares. Lots of interesting...

Stephen Avenue is a walkable main street downtown. It is lined with boutiques and cafes. It feels like you are in Europe in the middle of a busy city. It has beautiful architecture and you can feel the history of the city as you walk. You can see people casually talking on the sidewalk near a cafe and people quickly...

Stephen Avenue Walk is about a 4 or 5 block pedestrian mall. It is closed to traffic during the daytime but allows cars after 6:00 pm. Compared to other pedestrian malls in world cities, it is rather short and not very exciting, but for Calgarians, where the car is king, it is nice to be able to stroll downtown without...

This street is several blocks long and is designated for pedestrians only during the day. In the evenings cars are allowed -- so be careful where you are walking.During the day there are often street vendors and market tents set up - as well as entertainers. Both sides of the mall have numerous restaurants and some smaller independent shops....
I loved walking this avenue and we have something similar in Denver but ours has buses that run up and down it and this one is just for pedestrians only so it was much more enjoyable to walk.

If you like afternoon walks and watching people, go ahead and check out Stephen Avenue. There are lots of shops, bars and restaurants to choose from. Very touristy and busy at certain times. But since it is close to other Calgary attractions, taking a stroll here would be a good idea.

If you have a day in Calgary and want to get a sense of the city and eat out - its probably a good idea to visit - lots of restaurant options in the area. Some shopping as well - but dont expect more. Restaurants seemed very busy and it was difficult to get a table in many of them...

Looking for legacies...notice the dates on the foundations stones; looking for bargains...notice the prices that make fingers fidget around purses; looking for a good meal with good friends...notice the open-air venues that give you a chance to call over a passing acquaintance...Stephen Avenue has what you are looking for. Expect surprises...bands, jugglers, street entertainers...a piano to play...expect the pleasantly unexpected....

It was a sunny day when we walked Stephen Avenue, it is a lovely pedestrian street with stalls selling things, charity stalls also and loads of cafes, restaurants and shops. We didn't stop anywhere for food or drinks but everywhere had outdoor seating and looked busy.

Similar to grandville or robson in Vancouver but simple the not the same class with more restaurants than shops.While it provide a nice walk through downtown Calgary it felt more like a tourist trap without the tourist stores that tourist are looking for!!Downtown overall is not the best place to see or visit Calgary!!! Stay away unless you...

This pedestrian mall has its advantages and disadvantages. Like any city core, it is busy during business hours and dead on weekends. There are some interesting shops and restaurants and others that aren't so great- more like tourist traps than anything else. Worth the walk to be outside as opposed to malls with the added benefit of seeing some great...

This street is closed off from traffic during the day opening it up to pedestrians, which allows street vendors and some buskers to occupy the street on nice summer days. There are a lot of restaurants and a little shopping on the street.

We got quite a few bargains in the little shops on either side of Stephen Avenue. There are lovely buildings and its all lit up for Christmas. Really nice little places for lunch and dinner too. Well worth the visit.

A nice stroll with a few interesting shops. Stay on the outside, once you go into the mall, it's the same "old thing" as any other mall. The pubs are great and often have outdoor patios in the summer. My personal favourite is the James Joyce, but I always eat in because I love the decore.

I always stay at the Hyatt right by Stephen Ave (good hotel choice btw). There are several good restaurants and bars. If you're new to Calgary (a new favorite town) you'll enjoy strolling here. Don't pass the Trib steakhouse or the saltlik (even though it has fallen out of favor with locals). Grab a drink or dinner and continue to...

I live a block away from here so walk this area many times a week. There are a lot of old sandstone buildings to admire. at the end of your walk on the East is City Hall and Olympic Plaza. It is nice any time of the year. We have the odd vagrant but there is an obvious police presence.

Stephen Avenue Mall is a great place for a saunter and a bite to eat. For places to eat, I'd recommend James Joyce, an Irish pub with rustic wooden tables and beaches and lots of nooks for great convo. Plus the place is owned by an Irish couple from the north so is pretty authentic. The beer tends on the...

The Stephen Avenue Walk was a little breezy but the hanging flowers and overall general area were quite nice. The Glenbow Art Gallery is at one end of the Walk and it is a super place for families. Across the street is Cafe Rosso. The lady in the gallery shop told me that is where they all have lunch. I...

I liked Stephen Ave Walk. Generally there aren't enough pedestrian only shopping areas so I'm all for them. This one has a lot of different types of places to eat food: bistro, cafe, pubs, full service restaurants, etc. There are also some street vendors selling things like jewellry. Hubby & I went into Riley & McCormick's which has western clothing....
it is good for shopping during the day and good for partying at night. lots of good restaurants and bars. most of them are expensive

A few blocks of restaurants and stores in older preserved buildings on a pedestrian street. We had lunch on one end, ice cream cones on the other. In between we did a bit of shopping and rested in the park area with live entertain to watch. There were also food trucks and buskers along the way. A very nice place...

This is a great place to wander along if you're visiting Calgary, any time of the year.While there is plenty to see at street level, do look up often and admire some of the delightful architectural details of the buildings along the way. Do yourself a favor and pick up Harry Sanders' "Historic Walks of Calgary" from the Glenbow...

Many small and other stores are on this pedestrian mall. A range of restaurants and snack places are also on the mall. Several blocks long. A unique collection of sandstone low rise buildings preserved and built in about the early 20th century. Very open for business following our June 2013 floods. Enjoy the day or part of the day in...

This is one block south of the CTrain route in the Downtown area, most of it is only for pedestrian use, once you are past Centre Street - many of the shops, restaurants, hotels and often street vendors, food trucks and buskers for entertainment line this area that is especially lively on a warm evening. In the winter it is...
Lots of energy. There are many stores, restaurants, and people. Lots of pubs. Food is expensive and around $30+ per person. There are many restaurants offer outdoor sitting.

This holiday afternoon saw this street blazing - many many people shopping, dining and enjoying the perfect weather and a post flood emergence. Stephen Avenue is named after George Stephen, first president of the CPR. There are so many stores, bars and restaurants of all types, and as it is a pedestrian mall (between the hours of 6 am and...
Great atmosphere along this pedestrianised street with shops, restaurants, bars galore. Well worth walking end to end.

Beautiful and vibrant best describes this downtown Calgary area. Walking is leisurely as the streets are closed to vehicle traffic. There are plenty of legend maps readily available to find your way around. There is a huge modern enclosed mall with every shop you could imagine and many wonderful eatery's.

best outdoor mall ever shopped. If you start at one end of the street, you can easily spend the whole day shopping! All kinds of different stores to choose from. No cares are aloud down the street. Just walking and bikes. some good restaurants to stop and have a drink or a meal. And lots of stores with clothes

This pedestrian thoroughfare ran through the heart of Calgarys downtown. The only time it seemed particularly busy was around lunchtime. Every second person I saw held a to-go cup of coffee. By late afternoon, several bars  such as The Unicorn and James Joyce Irish Pub  had set out tables and chairs behind enclosing barriers. Along the mall there...
Shopping, People Watching, Decent Coffee Shops and Shopping Mall Nearby. On a sunny day this is the place to hang out.
Nice to have a walk in the middle of the city. Pedestrian mall has shopping, dining, street entertainment, accommodations and museum access.

We were staying in downtown Calgary over the Easter weekend and walked down Stephen Avenue on a sunny Friday afternoon. The streets were abandoned! I guess the downtown core emptied out during the long weekend. What a disappointment! At least the weather made for a pleasant walk.
An encapsulation of the city: strolling, people watching, terrace restaurants, buskers, shopping, visiting, photo ops, fast food, and (as people say) everything!

It is a good place to walk down if you want to people watch, day or night there will be someone or something to see there. You can also stop along the way a look at some of the historical pieces and there is a ton of restaurants, bars and pubs to tickle your fancy should you care to stop...

Great metro influenced walk in down town Calgary - There are numerous restaurants along the street and at a certain time of day the close the street to traffic and it becomes a walking only street. It is an almost magical place for food and shopping in the summer.
This is downtown Calgary and during the day a busy place with its many restaurants. At night it is not necessarily as pleasant. while still very safe.

Stephen Avenue is one of the nicest walks in Downtown Calgary, its always nice to take a stroll from Olympic Plaza down to the end. Lots of bars and shops for those who are interested. During the winter there isn't much going on other than the street being decorated in beautiful Christmas lights. In the summer, Stephen Avenue comes alive...
Great spot on the weekends - except for the pan handlers. Lots of good restaurants and shops. Like anywhere downtown, parking is a pain - choose a nearby parkade and walk over

It is an interesting place to spend a few hours wandering along and doing some window shopping. It is best done in the summer though as when it is winter in Calgary, Chinook or not....it is not always as pleasant.

I LOVE taking walks down here just for the sheer variety of vendors! There is too much to list here, just take my word for it, visit! Take a slow walk down the length all the way to Olympic Plaza, and you will be hooked!
Loved the variety of Restraurants, shops are great and close to the hotels. i want to try more places when I return.
Stephen Avenue has it. From the Bay and Winners to a slew of restaurants and pubs. Especially lovely in the summer with buskers aplenty.

My wife and I were in Calgary for a day completing a USA Visa application. We needed to find a place for lunch and ended up walking down a random street which happened to be Stephen Avenue. It was a chilly day and all along the unhurried street we found restaurant after restaurant almost calling out to us. Not having...
In order to fulfil a medical appointment I have passed along this mall. It is great to not have to worry about nothing but pedestrian traffic.
Yes, it really does have character when you have a nice day. Lots of activity, and a great place to people watch.
A great place to stroll along, find a good restaurant, buy something you need or just want. The only unpleasant feature? The beggars and the occasional noisy drunk.

I was recently working in Calgary at the Telus Convention Centre. During my breaks it was a pleasure to walk down Stephen Ave, get some fresh air and have a bit of exercise. Lots of good restaurants at every turn.

Stephen Avenue in Calgary is a great little spot downtown to hang out. With a huge variety of restaurants and cute little shops mixed in with pubs and big-box stores, there's nothing you can't do here! Also, the Calgary C-Train will take you within a short walking distance so it is easy to get to.

Beautiful street to wander down during the evening. There are so many cafes & shops, it'd take you months to visit them all! Definitely put this on your list to visit for a meal or just to enjoy the atmosphere!

I love the ebb and flow of People during the Summer. The entertainment, food kiosks and the unique shopping. You get to rub elbows with some talented musicians, tourists, business professionals and street people.

It is a nice street. Pedestrian everyday from 6AM to 6PM. Lots of restaurants, lots of people during lunch time. If you want a nice restaurant, arrive around 11:45 during lunch, or you wont get a place.The walk is just really nice. I bring everyone visiting Calgary there.

The giant TV for watching the Olympic games this summer was excellent! And I have seen lots of excellent musical groups performing (for free, or donate if you'd like to) along the Avenue during the day: Classical music ensembles, rock bands, folk musicians, Latin groups, buskers with guitars and saxophones - and that was just this week! Also lots of...
Im probably just jaded as i used to work just off the mall for several yearsbut it is a nice spot to browse and stroll while in the city.
Stephen Ave is a must see for Calgary. There are lots of great places to eat, drink, shop and have fun. We try and visit frequently.

Stephen Avenue is a great place to take out of town guests. There's lots to see, great access to the shops downtown and it really has some of the best restaurants in the city along the way. It's magical at Christmas time when it's all lit up with lights
There are lots of little shops and restaurants. In the summer you find also street vendors. Very nice walk.
A great place to just relax...walk around....eat good stuff....in general an all round enjoyable area. The kind of place I love to find when I am on vacation.

What at first appeared to be another mall proved a delightful distraction from chain shops. The mall serves to highlight many of the early buildings eg Hudson Bay Compamy (Now called The Bay) by the use of brass plagues and the history lesson. The mall comes alive at Stampede time especially but reading the events list many parts of the...
For the serious shopper and eateries are abundant. Beautiful stores and shops for everything.

To have such a friendy and energetic walkthrough in the downtown core is great. You feel the rush of the big city with its many people bustling through ......but at the same a stroll through Stephen Ave can remove you from the noise for a while.
It impressed me from the start. Good mix of outdoor patios, restaurants and bars!
Walking down Stephen Avenue is almost like walking down a European street--sidewalk cafes, lots of people enjoying the night out, etc.
Lots of shops, restaurants and the walk from one end of the mall to the other is filled with great patio restaurants and things to see. But is mostly shopping and food.
This is such a well kept street, and always have great flowers, stores, and vendors.
Nice area of downtown for shopping and places to eat.
Always something going on here especially during stampede week... Lots of restaurants, bars etc... fun place...!
good food and some different shopping that is nice to take in on a nice day
I used to work along Stephen Ave. (8th Ave downtown) and its always been full of life! Buskers, restaurants, interesting stores... people watching galore
I work close by and steven ave is always full of life awsome restaurants, great shopping, and buskers playing music. Great way to spend a sunny afternoon,

As spring is upon us and summer is closing in quickly, head down to Stephen Avenue, it is jam packed with people around lunch hour and is a great experience if you are new or travelling to Calgary, AB. Plenty of stores and vendors to meet your every need throughout the day and at night there is a good variety...
This is a place for beggers, you cant walk one block without being asked for money.

Went there on both Saturday and Sunday afternoon and the place was dead. All the bars and most of the restaurants didn't open til 5pm. I could see this being a decent place to go on a summer night (maybe), but until summer comes, there's really not much to see so I'm basing my 2/5 on that.
Good for a stroll downtown, pubs, shops etc. people traffic only, no cars allowed. Good to grab a bench and people watch
Have been here for years. Have seen many changes and improvements. A spot to go and see for sure. Lots to do and see. Shopping and eating. Can be dirty and very noisy.
Very rundown and seedy looking. Panhandlers abound. They are trying, but it's not for me/
Nothing to get excited about unless you like cfowd in the summer and desolation in the winter. A tourist trap, nothing more, nothing less.

This is a cobblestone walkway with trees and art lining the roadway. It's always hoping in the summer with music coming from the outside pubs, people are all smiles and buskers make it a lively place for an after dinner stroll. You cannot get board with hundreds of shopping stores and some of the best pubs/restaurants in the city here.
Downtown. nice enough walk along the river. Nice to see everyone out and about.
Interesting restaurant street with many of Calgary's best anchored by the Atrs Center at on end and The Bay and Holt Renfew at the other.

The pocket dogs stand in the summer is THE BEST! I eat from there almost every week. There is live music in the summer on Stephen ave and lots to see, buy, and do. Plus you are in the middle of downtown so it is very classy.
Stephen Avenue is no different from any other shopping street (e,g., Yonge St., St. Catherine St., etc.) A decent mix of bars, restaurants and shopping alternatives.

The scenery and architecture are really pretty downtown, but there isn't much I would want to shop for anymore. The books, music and gaming are all gone from downtown now. There is a lowly HMV. That is about it. I think you might want to check out the core mall if you are down there.
Really like to walk during lunch times. Nice to enjoy patio dinners in the summertime
Stephen Avenue walk has everything from shopping to food! Good way to spend a day browsing all the little stores
We often take our out of town visitors for a walk along it as they always enjoy this taste of Calgary.
Sit outside, enjoy the sun, listen to different accents and languages around and people watch!
Some of Calgarys greatest restaurants, pubs and shopping. A great way to spend an afternoon.
makes you feel like your in a small town but your in the middle of the city
Where does everyone go at night? It's no Robson or Whyte Ave. It could be though. ??

From City hall and Olympic Plaza in the east to the Hudson's Bay and old Eaton's store with Davonian Gardens to the west, there are many of the cities old stone buildings with plaques to tell you something about each one. A gift of remembrances for us old timers and a treasure to present to visitors and our younger generation...

As far as downs go, Calgary's is generally lacking in age and beauty. No interesting architecture here and definitely not vibrant and exciting compared to other great city down towns like Montreal, St.John's and Victoria. Some nice funky stores and restaurants is the only draw.
Excellent choice of places to eat, great to people watch as well.
A bit of Calgary History and no cars running you down....cafes, beer and museums along the way.
Food, drinks and shopping all in one strip. What more could you ask for? On top of the great downtown Calgary vibe. Always a great time out with friends day or night!
This area will always attract the criminal element. Great city planning!
This is an adorable street to walk down. There are several great shops and restaurants. Especially if you are staying in a hotel downtown its great way to spend an evening.
Lovely walk and numerous Stores, Restaurants and pubs
Lots of different shops. Haven't been there for a while to see what is new.
Great shops safe if you come to Calgary a great place to walk. It gets into the bar scene in the evening and should not be missed during Stampede.
Plenty of shopping, bars and restaurants in this pedestrianised area, with the Olympic Plaza at one end. Very relaxing to chill out.

Stephen Avenue has been given a nice facelift over the past few years and it's now a good place to walk down and browse through the shops, or more likely to eat. There are a number of good restaurants there, one which we particularly enjoy is Milestones, which has good, reasonably priced food for downtown.
Some good new restaurants that I want to go to.Have been to a few of the bars there..overall I am not crazy about downtown outdoor malls...still a little gritty..but movin' on up!
It is a gem of an area to have a casual walk, stop to shop, or have a bit to eat and or drink

The idea of the "closed to traffic" street is a good one but unless controlled, and constantly patrolled, it becomes a haven for the seedy types that live in the underbelly of the city. Walking along the Avenue and having the bar patrons blowing smoke and constantly spitting on the sidewalk is annoying as well as disgusting.After the 3rd...
bikes shold also be allowed thereand bike thieves should be punished extremely hardtoo many bike thefts happen there. police doing nothing about it
I was visitng my husband while he was on a business trip. It was so fun to walk down from our hotel and his work and find a indoor shopping center. I especially enjoyed the interconnecting walkways.
Variety is great, from high end fashion to high end outdoor gear. Plenty of nice restaurants and bars as well. Good way to spend a day or even a weekend!
Great little walking outdoor mall. Lots of fun in summer, not so great in winter!

I really enjoy on a warm evening to walk along Stephen Ave. Walk with all the beautiful sights of old buildings, outside patio's, great restaurants, theatre, shop windows and all the people you see and even know. Often in the summer their are musicians, art shows and in the winter carollers along with the craft markets in the convention centre....

This Ave was the only rescue for me during my busy business trip to Calgary. With lot many restaurant, Canadian/Indian/Thai and coffeeshos and Malls, shops - this Ave is full of life.... Mango Shiva, Sandstone-Hyaat and Thai Rose are few good places to visit...

Pleasant enough place to be.... Monday to Friday between 10-4 that is. Any other time, it's like people deliberately go out of their way to avoid this commercial pedestrian walk. Saturdays and Sundays, and especially anytime after 6pm, it's like walking out into a ghost town.
A nice walkway for pedestrians downtown with early 1900's building's, bars, dining and lots of shopping.

On Saturday morning 7/23/2011 I walked along Stephen Avenue with husband and two friends. I enjoyed seeing the sculptures (The Trees, The Conversation) and we went into a couple of the shopping areas. Based on information that I read, I expected it to be very lively (many people, maybe street performers) but it was very quiet. We returned to the...

If you're looking for a meal and you're not sure what you're in the mood to eat, this is dining central for Calgary. It also has a variety of shops. Be advised if you are very conservative, that the t-shirt shops are more what we would have called "head shops" in the 70s. While dining, shopping or just walking around,...

Hard to imagine so many shops and the access to it all from indoors or out... The city has closed off a section of 8th Ave that allows people to walk without much concern and as mentioned by another on a warm sunny day it can get much better then to rest on one of many benches and soak in...
You can only walk down this part of the street full of food and shops. This is my favorite place to spend a warm sunny day at lunch. Live music and food. Awesome
Nice to watch and do some shopping, you come round when you are in a townhotel
